intro: Chrysophyllum revolutum, commonly known as the African butter fruit, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces smooth, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, buttery flavor. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and agroforestry systems.
